vendor: Darena Solutions LLC dba Darena Health (formerly MeldRx)

access.notes: Registered URL 301-redirects to darena.health, then JS-redirects to /onc-hti1-certified. The #b10 anchor works on the final page. EHI documentation is inline on the page, plus detailed API docs at docs.darena.health (Postman).

export_format.description: EHI export uses FHIR Bulk Data $export (NDJSON output) for structured data across 24 FHIR resource types. Non-FHIR resources are exported as DocumentReference resources which can wrap any file including CCDA XML documents.

documentation.notes: The b(10) documentation is two paragraphs inline on the ONC certification page, plus API endpoint documentation on docs.darena.health (Postman). There is no downloadable data dictionary or field-level documentation. The 24 supported FHIR resource types are listed on the DH Schema import page.

clinical.evidence: Patient, Encounter, AllergyIntolerance, Condition, Procedure, Observation, DiagnosticReport, Goal, Immunization, CarePlan, CareTeam, Medication, MedicationRequest, MedicationDispense, ServiceRequest, Specimen FHIR resources

secure_messages.evidence: No Communication, Message, or inbox-related FHIR resources listed. Documentation only mentions standard FHIR clinical resources.

billing_financial.evidence: No Claim, ExplanationOfBenefit, ChargeItem, Invoice, or other financial FHIR resources listed. The 24 supported resources are clinical-focused.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Coverage FHIR resource is listed as a supported resource type.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No Appointment or Schedule FHIR resource listed among the 24 supported types.

documents_images.evidence: DocumentReference resource is listed and explicitly mentioned as the mechanism for non-FHIR data export, including CCDA files and any arbitrary document attachments.

audit_trails.evidence: No AuditEvent or Provenance FHIR resource listed. The ONC page mentions 170.315(d)(2) Auditable Events compliance but this is separate from the EHI export content.

downloaded_files.notes: Postman SPA shell - requires browser to render full content

issues: Swagger documentation link (https://app.meldrx.com/swagger/index.html) referenced in b(10) section returns 404
EHI export documentation is extremely minimal — two paragraphs with no data dictionary or field-level detail
No dedicated b(10) downloadable artifact (PDF, ZIP, etc.) — documentation is only inline HTML and Postman API docs
Domain migration from darenasolutions.com to darena.health requires following JS redirect
Postman docs site (docs.darena.health) is an SPA requiring browser to view
Platform serves 11 different EHR products through a shared FHIR middleware — unclear what EHR-specific data each product stores beyond the 24 standard FHIR resources
No billing/financial data in export (no Claim, ExplanationOfBenefit, etc.) despite being required for full EHI
No secure messaging data in export
No audit trail data in export
summary: Darena Health (formerly MeldRx) is a FHIR middleware platform used by 11 different EHR vendors for ONC certification. The b(10) EHI export uses FHIR Bulk Data $export across 24 standard FHIR resource types (clinical data plus Coverage and DocumentReference), with non-FHIR resources exported as DocumentReference wrappers. The export documentation is minimal — just two paragraphs on the ONC certification page linking to (now-dead) swagger docs and a FHIR Bulk Data spec, supplemented by a Postman API documentation site at docs.darena.health. There is no data dictionary, no field-level documentation, and several important EHI domains (billing, scheduling, messaging, audit trails) appear absent from the supported resource types. The DH Schema sample request body on the Postman docs provides example JSON structures showing a proprietary-to-FHIR mapping format.
